Line 195: Line 195:
Many popular multimedia codecs are installed by default in Linux Mint. Ubuntu, and many other free GNU/Linux distributions, do not distribute these codecs with the initial install media due to [[software patent|patent]] encumberment issues.
Many popular multimedia codecs are installed by default in Linux Mint. Ubuntu, and many other free GNU/Linux distributions, do not distribute these codecs with the initial install media due to [[software patent|patent]] encumberment issues.
â
Ubuntu has a vastly larger support community than Linux Mint. However, the majority of Ubuntu help and advice is also applicable to Linux Mint. Ubuntu supports more languages from the LiveCD, and comes with better localization.{{Fact|date=December 2007}} Lastly, whilst Linux Mint only supports [[x86]] architectures, Ubuntu also supports [[x86-64]].
+
Ubuntu has a vastly larger support community than Linux Mint. However, the majority of Ubuntu help and advice is also applicable to Linux Mint. Ubuntu supports more languages from the Live CD, and comes with better localization.{{Fact|date=December 2007}} Lastly, whilst Linux Mint only supports [[x86]] architectures, Ubuntu also supports [[x86-64]].
